instruction: How did the researchers compare the use of destructive analytical methods with nondestructive hyperspectral measurements in investigating the effects of fungal infections on plant metabolites?
Output: The researchers compared the use of destructive analytical methods with nondestructive hyperspectral measurements by investigating the interaction between sugar beet leaves and two fungal pathogens, Cercospora beticola and Uromyces betae. They conducted destructive analyses to determine the effects of the diseases on various plant metabolites, such as chlorophylls, carotenoids, flavonoids, and phenols. Additionally, they used nondestructive hyperspectral measurements in the UV range to observe spectral changes in the plants. By comparing the results from both methods, they were able to identify specific reflectance patterns and spectral changes associated with each disease. Machine learning algorithms were then used to differentiate between the symptom classes and recognize the two sugar beet diseases. This comparison demonstrated the utility of nondestructive hyperspectral imaging in investigating the influence of fungal infections on plant physiology and biochemistry.
